articles.title: Brent jumps $3 after U.S. kills Iran's Soleimani
articles.description: Oil prices jumped more than $3 on Friday after a U.S. air strike in Baghdad ordered by President Donald Trump killed the head of Iran's elite Quds Force, sparking concerns for an escalation of regional tensions and disruption to crude supplies.

articles.title: Lebanon's crisis needs $20 bln-$25 bln bailout, former minister says
articles.description: Lebanon needs a $20 billion-$25 billion bailout including International Monetary Fund support to emerge from its financial crisis, former economy minister Nasser Saidi told Reuters on Friday.
articles.content:
BEIRUT (Reuters) - Lebanon needs a $20 billion-$25 billion bailout including International Monetary Fund support to emerge from its financial crisis, former economy minister Nasser Saidi told Reuters on Friday.

articles.title: Factbox: Allies widen Iran's Middle East reach
articles.description: As Iran vows to take revenge for the killing of one of its top military commanders, Major General Qassem Soleimani, it can count on the support of groups that are part of a Tehran-led alliance across the region.'
articles.content:
BEIRUT (Reuters) - As Iran vows to take revenge for the killing of one of its top military commanders, Major General Qassem Soleimani, it can count on the support of groups that are part of a Tehran-led alliance across the region.

articles.title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX slips at open as U.S. air strike raises Middle East tensions
articles.description: Canada's main stock index fell at the open on Friday after a U.S. air strike in Iraq killed a top Iranian commander, sharply escalating geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, though a jump in energy shares kept losses in check.
articles.content:

articles.title: Loonie near flat as Middle East tensions lessen risk appetite
articles.description: The Canadian dollar was little changed against its U.S. counterpart on Friday after escalation of geopolitical tensions in the Middle East boosted safe-haven assets, including the greenback.

TORONTO (Reuters) - The Canadian dollar was little changed against its U.S. counterpart on Friday after escalation of geopolitical tensions in the Middle East boosted safe-haven assets, including the greenback.

articles.title: Mexico president won't comment on U.S. killing of top Iranian commander
articles.description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Friday that he will not comment on a U.S. air strike in Baghdad that killed the commander of Iran's elite Quds Force, Qassem Soleimani.
articles.content:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Friday that he will not comment on a U.S. air strike in Baghdad that killed the commander of Iran’s elite Quds Force, Qassem Soleimani.
